page.title: 18Buses;Other routes:Cheshire.
page.content: 2 vehicles per family is not rare (except in Saighton),so buses often run at a loss being under-used.Buses over the whole area only run every 2 hours with more before 9am.& around 5pm. (5 services use the A41 road but as they take various routes buses are not more frequent).There are none on Sunday & some do not run on Saturday, Tuesday or Thursday either. In the NE.only pleasure craft now use the Shropshire Union canal with 24 (cabin cruisers & long boats) by the towpath at private moorings.Also in the NE.is the partly embanked multiple track railway from Chester to Crewe but the track from the Whitchurch branch has been replaced by poor trees,rough grass,brambles,weeds & a stony path.Other paths are by or from the canal & are like the 8 leading to Saighton (4 from the A41) little used.
